intro: Tanacetum saxatile, commonly known as alpine tansy, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that resemble those of chamomile. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and dry grasslands. Tanacetum saxatile is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its aromatic properties.
